DOC.brief_summary: Depression pregnancy postpartum major public health problem adverse correlate consequence woman child ; although efficacious treatment depression pregnancy exist , woman receive care . A widely recognize barrier treatment engagement lack effective , available care well align woman 's treatment preference . To close gap treatment need receipt among depressed pregnant woman , study aim develop test effectiveness disseminate behavioral activation , efficacious acceptable treatment depression , use peer delivery pregnant woman depression .
DOC.brief_title: Mom Moms Study : Peer Delivery Behavioral Activation Depression During Pregnancy
DOC.detailed_description: Using 3-phase structure , study : ( 1 ) refine BA intervention delivery peer obstetric setting , ( 2 ) develop test web-based peer delivery training fidelity tool , ( 3 ) evaluate feasibility , tolerability , acceptability , safety preliminary effectiveness BA peer delivery within community-based obstetric practice setting , consistent experimental therapeutic approach , test extent delivery approach engage putative target validate prior study BA explore novel target potentially specific peer delivery .
DOC.criteria: STAKEHOLDERS ( Phase 1 ) : Inclusion : Any Kaiser Permanente Colorado ( KPCO ) staff provide oversee obstetric behavioral health service , include obstetric behavioral health clinical administrative staff , health plan manager . Exclusion : PATIENTS ( Phase 1 ) : Inclusion : KPCO member woman At least 18 year age History depression pregnancy postpartum Current Patient Health Questionnaire ( PHQ9 ) score < 10 Exclusion : Lifetime diagnosis bipolar psychotic disorder , active mania , psychosis , substance abuse Immediate risk selfharm Unable speak read English PATIENTS ( Phase 23 ) : Inclusion : KPCO member pregnant woman At least 18 year age Baseline score ≥ 10 Patient Health Questionnaire ( PHQ9 ) Exclusion : Lifetime diagnosis bipolar psychotic disorder , active mania , psychosis , substance abuse Immediate risk selfharm Unable speak read English PEERS ( Phase 23 ) : Inclusion : KPCO member mother At least 18 year age At least high school education A selfreported history recovery depression An express desire help people mental health problem Available schedule training , BA delivery , peer supervision Access internet training supervision Exclusion : Failure demonstrate passing intervention quality train Baseline score ≥ 10 Patient Health Questionnaire ( PHQ9 )
